header.title: Jo Swinson faces backlash after branding TV broadcasters 'sexist' for debate exclusion
header.subtitle: LIBERAL DEMOCRAT leader Jo Swinson sparked a furious backlash after she accused British TV broadcast of being “sexist” for leaving her out of the election debates.
header.postText: 'Jo Swinson has been attacked online after she accused TV broadcasters of sexist behaviour after ITV excluded her for the upcoming election debate. The Liberal Democrats have lodged a formal complaint with ITV, claiming there was no reasonable justification for staging a debate involving only Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn.Speaking on Sky News, the Liberal Democrat leader said the action was clearly“ sexist” since she was a woman.', ' The debate, scheduled for 19 November, will make television history as the first head - to - head debate between the leaders of the two main parties.', 'ITV’ s news presenter Julie Etchingham will be in charge of quizzing the leaders.', ' Ms Swinson told Sophy Ridge: I am a candidate to be a Prime Minister in this election, and frankly when you look at how Boris Johnson and Jeremy Corbyn are carrying on, I think I could do a better job than either of them.', 'It is ridiculous that on the biggest debate facing our country, you have one side of that debate completely unrepresented.', 'Ridge responded that the Liberal Democrats only had 20 seats - compared to the 542 MPs between Labour and the Conservatives.', 'Ms Swinson pointed to the three - way debates in the 2010 campaign, claiming that the Liberal Democrats are closer to the main parties now than they were then.', 'Suggesting that sexism was behind the move, the Liberal Democrat leader said: 'In that election we had Gordon Brown, David Cameron and Nick Clegg - spot the difference.', 'Frankly, you 've got a suggestion from a broadcaster that it will be two chaps chatting about how they are going to leave the European Union, leaving out the voice for millions of Remainers who want to stop Brexit and stay in the EU.' , 'And, yeah, I happen to be a woman, well isn't that interesting because when it was Nick Clegg there was no problem with him being in the debates.', 'Either it 's sexist, or they're scared, or maybe it 's a bit of both.', 'However, online viewers were unimpressed with her remarks, with many commenting that the excuse was painful to watch.', 'One commented: It's because she's irrelevant, despite her delusions of grandeur.', 'Several pointed out that if the reason was sexism then Nicola Sturgeon had a better claim of a debate place since the SNP outnumbered Liberal Democrats in Westminster.', 'Another tweeted: It's not sexism, it's a debate between the two people who can conceivably be PM.', 'Chuka Umunna had earlier tweeted an attack on the TV broadcasters.', 'The senior Liberal Democrat MP said: Excluding women from the #GE2019 leaders' debates is sexist, undemocratic and wrong.', 'These two blokes don 't speak for Britain, we are not a 2 party country and the millions of people who want to #stopbrexit won't have a voice.'
header.socioLingVar: Gender - General,Age - Youngsters,Nationality - European or anti-Europeans,Age - Over 65s,Nationality - General,Ethnicity - General

commentThread.commentText: full Of  her own importance, thinks she is going to be next prime minister. Who does she think she is.

I was going to say exactly the same but I would have added who does this mouthy woman think she is too full then your words why do they think hand gestures and insults and lots of useless words impress

commentThread.commentText: Sorry Swinson, but I think you will find Labour don’t want Brexit, stop throwing your dummy out when you are ignored, you have this me, me, me attitude that gets right up peoples nose, you also forget we voted leave, NOT remain.
Not because she is a woman but because she is irrelevant.
Bore. Big bore. Big feminist bore.
This woman is completely disillusioned she will never be PM and will be gone after the election awful voice and all.
Not even among the top 3 parties in Parliament, what next ? The Greens get to join in too ? There’s a thought though, Swinson v Lucas, they can scratch each other’s eyes out. Swinson is delusional.
maybe nobody thinks your opinion counts for anything !!!
.I cannot watch this Swinson woman or listen to her voice. To come out with a 'sexist' suggestion is childish and a signal that she has no arguments worth listening to.
“The millions of people who want to #stopbrexit won't have a voice." Yes they did and guess what THEY LOST, 17.4 million won its about time OUR voice was heard you spoilt brat.
If I never see the undemocratic Swinson again it will be too soon!
She certainly has delusions of grandeur!   Jo Swinson certainly loves Jo Swinson.

I think it has more to do with that fact that you are the leader of a "minor" political party, whereas the head to head debates are for the leaders of the primary parties. You know, the ones who actually have a chance of winning an election. You will get your chance. Broadcasters have scheduled open debates for you minor players to chip in.
Jo Swinson , my second favourite comedian !
As far as I'm concerned the prime reason she should not appear is that she is incredibly boring and stupid. At least Soubry and Abbott are amusing as well as being stupid.

Mouth almighty Swinson as she is known in our household. Does she think shouting loudly makes her message important? It usually signifies the message is of low value. I find it unbelievable the Lib Dums could choose another thicky for leader. Did they learn nothing from choosing Clegg a few years back. There really is something incredibly juvenile in their rantings.
by playing the sexist card she  shows her up as a political pygmy,

I think that it is not relevant that Swinson is in the debate. The LibDems wait for the elections to finish and then the people who stood  on a Conservative manifesto that they don't believe in, move to the LibDems. Why do the LibDems have to even stand in elections anyway?
The Liberals are good at over estimating their importance. I remember their "Return to your constituencies and prepare for government" statement
I think she should be invited on the debate so she can show the electorate just how hopeless she is.

frankly.....frankly.....you know...….what a thicko....plays the poor defenceless "sexist discrimination" card just like clintone a o cortez and pestaloosi when they are out of their depth and losing the plot

With a bit of luck she will lose her seat at the election

commentThread.commentText: Another Theresa May. Utterly obsessed by the idea that being female she MUST therefore be a 'victim' of sexism. And the absolute disaster that May was as PM, as a result of this deluded thinking affecting her judgements and appointments, would be replicated by Swinson if she was to become PM - thankfully never going to happen!!
And on the eighth day God created the Swinson sent to save us all from ourselves

Being Scottish I'm suprised she didn't play the race card as well.
She comes across as psychotic to me...
she has no chance

at the last election the Brexit party got more individual votes than the lib dems.
or it could be more the fact that they know, if she was on, then people would not bother tuning in to watch, because her voice grates on you, and they do not want tolisten to a lot of mince.

Hissy fit alert. The people voted love, and the result was leave. You'd do well to remind yourself you're supposed to be part of a DEMOCRACY, taking the vote from 17.4m people is NOT democratic. You've got to admit that to yourself, and stop hiding from it. You can change the rhetoric alllll you like so you can pursuade yourself you're doing something righteous so you can don't have to listen to that tiny conscious of yours but we all see it as plain as day.
